alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Logan; Newton; Pope (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 7:35PM CDT until May 24 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Logan County in western Arkansas... Southwestern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Johnson County in western Arkansas... Northwestern Pope County in central Arkansas... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 735 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Cass to Woodland to Scranton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Lamar... Knoxville... Scranton... Dillen... Woodland... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Devils Knob... Midway in Logan County... Walnut... Spadra... Bertha... Tokalon... Holman... Rosetta... Lake Dardanelle... Morrison Bluff... Oak Grove in Johnson County... Catalpa... Fort Douglas... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 54 and 68. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
